description: Proposed change of use of second and third floors from Commercial, Business and Service (ancillary storage and accommodation Use Class E) to 2no. self-contained residential units (Use Class C3) with associated bin store
decision_conditions: Under Schedule 2, Part 3, Class G of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The application fails to demonstrate that the second and third floors have a  lawful use for Class E purposes, and therefore do not benefit with the provisions  of Class G. Insufficient evidence has been submitted by the applicant to otherwise demonstrate that the application site has been in ancillary Class E use.

Under Schedule 2, Part 3, Class G of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The application fails to demonstrate that the proposed development and  future residents would not be at risk  from flooding. No Flood Risk Assessment has been submitted. In the absence of which the application has failed to  demonstrate the finished floor levels, flood resistance and resilience measures, access and escape.  The proposal is contrary to Paragraph 167 of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Under Schedule 2, Part 3, Class G of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval is required and refused. The proposal would be contrary to, in particular, the aims and objectives of the Nationally Described Space Standards (2015) owing to its failure to provide sufficient information / evidence to demonstrate that the proposed development would meet the required floor to ceiling height and space standards.
